instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook Air Works for about a minute and then shuts down
threads.message: Hello this is my first post, don't know where to start, but I have question to ask, I have macbook air Board Model <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Issue with that macbook is, it turns on and boots, by the time it reach to user screen it turns off, I did remove trackpad , keyboard , even SSD it behaves the same, I don't know where to start, Only thing I noticed  at 2 mosfets <TRANSISTOR>Q7321</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7311</TRANSISTOR> it shows me Resistance between pin 1 and 5 around 25,26 ohm, is that the right resistance. also forgot to mention I didn't saw any liquid damage sign. Thanks

threads.title: Macbook Air Works for about a minute and then shuts down
threads.message: Cold be ME region problem on bios, upload your backup to be fixed.....

threads.title: Macbook Air Works for about a minute and then shuts down
threads.message: ME does not cause shutdown issues on Apple boards only PC boards. Question here is what is the history of this machine? I hope it is liquid else it will probably be hopeless.
